thread.title: Senate Democrats Promise To Filibuster Trump’s Supreme Court Nominee
thread.title_full: Senate Democrats Promise To Filibuster Trump’s Supreme Court Nominee

author: Andrew Kerr
title: Senate Democrats Promise To Filibuster Trump’s Supreme Court Nominee
text:
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 30, 2017 
“This is a stolen seat,” Merkley told Politico , pointing to senate Republicans and their refusal to give President Obama’s Supreme Court nomination, Merrick Garland, a hearing or vote in 2016. 
“This is the first time a Senate majority has stolen a seat,” Merkley said Monday. “We will use every lever in our power to stop this.” Advertisement - story continues below 
“I will definitely object to a simple majority,” Merkley pledged, adding that “a very large number” of his Democratic senate colleagues will join him in opposing Trump’s nominee. 
Merkely’s promise to object to a simple majority vote means that Trump’s nominee will need 60 votes in order to be confirmed by the senate. 
Sen. Amy Klobuchar, D-Minn., implied she would join in on the filibuster effort Sunday evening, tweeting that Supreme Court nominee will need 60 votes to be confirmed. Remember this week when Supreme Ct nominee is announced, vote threshold is SIXTY votes, different from the 51 vote margin w/other nominees 
— Amy Klobuchar (@amyklobuchar) January 30, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below
